Business Name: Marcus A Jones III Attorney at Law
Business Information: For more than 35 years, Marcus A. Jones, III, P.C. Attorney at law in Birmingham, AL, has represented clients as a general practice attorney with focus on family law, criminal defense and probate cases. We are passionate about the law and a leader in the local legal community. We are responsive and accessible, returning calls and emails and answering questions promptly. We have a 24-hour answering service to ensure clients can reach us whenever necessary. Schedule a free initial consultation.

At Roderick Walls & Associates, LLC our attorneys and staff understand and appreciate that with each client comes a unique set of circumstances and needs. We are a firm committed to fulfilling the needs of each of our clients through open communication and relationships built on trust. Roderick Walls & Associates, LLC 's areas of expertise are as a variant as the clients the firm serves. The firm provides professional, caring and experienced representation in a number of areas: Personal Injury, Automobile Accidents, Criminal Defense, DUI, Juvenile Offenses, Social Security Claims, Workmen's Compensation, Familly Law, Domestic Law, Child Support and Divorce

Since 1996, our firm has served as a fierce advocate for the rights and interests of our clients. Due to our experience, skill and record of success, our peers recognize the legal team at Marsh, Rickard & Bryan as a force in and out of the courtroom.

At Simms & Associates, we have defended those accused of a crime and advocated for those who have suffered a personal injury or wrongful death of a loved one. In all of our cases, we provide attentive service to our clients and allow them to benefit from our experience. Legal experience is matched by a unique background in the auto insurance industry. Point-of-view has benefited many clients in the past and can benefit you. Criminal charges can impact every aspect of your life. Your right to drive a vehicle, where and with whom you may live, the cost of insurance, and of course your freedom, can be affected by a criminal conviction. A severe and preventable injury can cause physical and emotional pain that prevents you from enjoying life and working as you did before the accident. 
 
At the law firm of Simms & Associates in Birmingham, we understand that you need diligent and experienced representation from an experienced trial attorney to ensure that your rights are protected. We believe you deserve the best possible outcome, and we dedicate all of our resources to that important goal.

Birmingham, Alabama s Sheffield & Lentine, PC, is dedicated to zealous and professional representation of those accused of felony and misdemeanor offenses in all municipal, state and federal courts of Alabama. Our firm can also help clients with Post-Conviction Appeals and Rule 32 Petitions for Post-Conviction Relief. n addition to specializing in all areas of criminal defense, we assist people in the areas of personal injury, domestic relations and family law. Our lawyers understand our clients lives and futures depend on our work and each client s case is given the attention, care and personal expertise that is necessary to insure successful results. Our lawyers have over 50 years of combined actual trial experience in criminal and civil cases in the State of Alabama and Federal courts, and our commitment to helping those in need and our proven results reflect our dedication.

Providing clients in Trussville, Birmingham and surrounding areas a variety of legal services, including Family Law (Child Custody, Child Support), Criminal Law, DUI, and more. David L. Scott understands the stress and uncertainty that can come with almost any legal situation. You need an attorney that will explain all of your options and will treat you with respect and care. This is exactly what David does! Offering quality legal help at reasonable rates. For affordable and attentive legal representation, give us a call and see what David L. Scott can do for you!

The family of attorneys at Burge & Burge, PC, is committed to helping you and your family after an accident, injury or disabling illness. We understand the difficulty individuals encounter when they try to recover compensation on their own. Our experienced personal injury lawyers can make the process easier.

At stake in drunk driving litigation is your right to drive, your freedom from imprisonment, and your civil rights and liberties.  At the Dodd Law Firm, our Birmingham DUI lawyers fight for your rights.  A Birmingham DWI lawyer from our firm provides you with qualified legal advice as you make your way through the maze of legal proceedings. We are dedicated to protecting clients' rights against the prosecution's interest in obtaining a conviction.  Our Birmingham drunk driving lawyers leverage substantial legal skill and networks of professional contacts to help clients deal with a DUI citation, arrest, or conviction.
At Bates, Hetzel, PC., we pride ourselves on being a full-service law firm that can handle any legal issue you may have.

In operation since 2000, Christian & Small is a full-service law firm. It offers a range of counseling and litigation services. The firm represents clients in cases related to antitrust, bankruptcy, business transactions, domestic relations, government affairs, insurance, health care, product and liquor liability, real estate, tax, and estate and trust planning. Christian & Small provides legal services to clients in matters that involve trademark infringement, unfair competition, dilution and the misappropriation of trade secrets. It defends individuals and businesses in criminal investigation matters. The firm also defends transportation companies in personal injury, employment, and cargo and property damage cases. In addition, Christian & Small offers advisory services for operating, independent contractor, joint venture and buy-sell agreements, as well as employment contracts.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Business Name: Gelch & Associates Personal Injury Law Firm
Business Information: Have you been injured due to someone else's negligence? Since 2004, we've successfully represented thousands of individuals injured in auto and boating accidents, slip and falls, animal attacks, and more. We also represent individuals harmed by recalled drugs, medical malpractice, negligent security, and nursing home abuse.  Your initial consultation is free. We work on a contingent fee basis, which means that we only get paid if you do! Call today to get the the compensation you deserve.

With 18+ years of experience and 20,000+ Alabama charges resolved, Kreps Law Firm has the experience and the knowledge to know when to turn up the heat and be aggressive and when to dial it back. We know you are in a difficult situation, and we want you to know that with Kreps, you don't have to face it alone. We're here to help you every step of the way.

About Belinda A. Weldon;    Belinda has been a criminal defense attorney since 1998.  She has devoted her career to aggressively defending people charged with crimes and protecting their constitutional rights. She has represented individuals in a broad variety of criminal matters, which has provided her with an in-depth understanding of Alabama criminal law and procedure.  Belinda worked as a police officer for 15 years including twelve years in criminal investigations and forensics before becoming a criminal defense attorney.  As a former police investigator, she understands the criminal justice system; from both sides. Her experience and unique background enable her to work with clients through the toughest cases.    She knows the criminal justice system and gets excellent results for clients utilizing her experience both as a police investigator and forensic crime scene investigator which has made her an aggressive and successful criminal defense attorney.  Her ability to conduct criminal investigations for the defense as well as her unique understanding of forensic evidence is invaluable when defending her clients.    She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. She understands police procedure, prosecution tactics and the court process. She will fight for you every step of the way.   Belinda has successfully handled hundreds of criminal cases and jury trials from the most serious crimes such as capital murder to traffic violations like DUI.  She has experience in all aspects of criminal courts from bond hearings to jury trials where she has successfully won NOT GUILTY verdicts from capital murder cases to DUI cases.   She is a member of a number of professional organizations such as: National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers; the Alabama Criminal Defense Lawyers Association; and the Greater Birmingham Criminal Defense Lawyers Association.  She is one of a handful of Alabama criminal defense attorneys who graduated from the National Criminal Defense College (NCDC).

Business Name: Law Offices of James M. Allen
Business Information: The Law Offices of James M. Allen, LLC is a litigation firm located in Birmingham, Alabama. We strongly believe that our track record and reputation for handling personal injury, DUI defense, municipal court matters, juvenile law, and civil litigation has established a tradition of dedication to our clients best interests. Although the vast majority of cases reach a settlement, we are not afraid to try a case to verdict. If you have been charged with DUI, if you have been arrested on a misdemeanor charge, if your child has gotten off course and needs our help, if you have received a traffic citation, or you or a loved one has been seriously injured, then give the Law Offices of James M. Allen a call today.

The Birmingham criminal defense attorneys at Jaffe, Hanle, Whisonant & Knight, P.C., find focused solutions for serious legal matters. If you have been arrested or accused in Alabama, turn to a firm that you can trust. We have decades of combined experience and an in-depth knowledge of the law and are recognized in our area for our record of success. We represent individuals in drug crime charges, DUI, cyber crimes, juvenile crimes, misdemeanors, sex crimes, theft crimes, violent offenses, and white collar crimes in state, federal, and appellate courts. These cases can be incredibly complex and require an in-depth knowledge of the law, which is why it is vital that you turn to a Birmingham criminal defense lawyer from Jaffe, Hanle, Whisonant & Knight, P.C.

Founded in 2001, Alexander Shunnarah Injury Lawyer, P.C. is one of the premium law firms in Alabama and the southeastern United States. It deals in a variety of legal cases, such as personal injury, wrongful death, workers compensation, criminal defense and product liability issues. The firm specializes in the field of personal injury, including car accidents, truck accidents, workers compensation and multiple personal injuries. Alexander Shunnarah Injury Lawyer, P.C. is a member of the Association of Trial Lawyers of America, Alabama Association for Justice, Alabama State Bar and Birmingham Bar Association.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

Attorneys at Parkman White, LLP have more than 100 years of combined experience in a wide range of practice areas, with a particular emphasis on courtroom litigation. Indeed, the firm is prepared to represent clients nationally or in any courtroom in Alabama. Parkman and White, meanwhile, have both been AV Preeminent rated by Martindale-Hubbell, a testament to the fact that their peers rank them at the highest level of professional experience. 
Parkman, who has handled hundreds of major felony cases during his 34-year career, attributes the firm’s success to its extensive courtroom expertise: "Ultimately, whether you win or lose the case is in the jury’s hands, so in order to be successful for your clients you have to know how to deal with a jury. The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

About Belinda A. Weldon;    Belinda has been a criminal defense attorney since 1998.  She has devoted her career to aggressively defending people charged with crimes and protecting their constitutional rights. She has represented individuals in a broad variety of criminal matters, which has provided her with an in-depth understanding of Alabama criminal law and procedure.  Belinda worked as a police officer for 15 years including twelve years in criminal investigations and forensics before becoming a criminal defense attorney.  As a former police investigator, she understands the criminal justice system; from both sides. Her experience and unique background enable her to work with clients through the toughest cases.    She knows the criminal justice system and gets excellent results for clients utilizing her experience both as a police investigator and forensic crime scene investigator which has made her an aggressive and successful criminal defense attorney.  Her ability to conduct criminal investigations for the defense as well as her unique understanding of forensic evidence is invaluable when defending her clients.    She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. She understands police procedure, prosecution tactics and the court process. She will fight for you every step of the way.   Belinda has successfully handled hundreds of criminal cases and jury trials from the most serious crimes such as capital murder to traffic violations like DUI.  She has experience in all aspects of criminal courts from bond hearings to jury trials where she has successfully won NOT GUILTY verdicts from capital murder cases to DUI cases.   She is a member of a number of professional organizations such as: National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers; the Alabama Criminal Defense Lawyers Association; and the Greater Birmingham Criminal Defense Lawyers Association.  She is one of a handful of Alabama criminal defense attorneys who graduated from the National Criminal Defense College (NCDC).

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. She is a member of a number of professional organizations such as: National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers; the Alabama Criminal Defense Lawyers Association; and the Greater Birmingham Criminal Defense Lawyers Association.  She is one of a handful of Alabama criminal defense attorneys who graduated from the National Criminal Defense College (NCDC).

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

She knows the criminal justice system and gets excellent results for clients utilizing her experience both as a police investigator and forensic crime scene investigator which has made her an aggressive and successful criminal defense attorney. She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. She is a member of a number of professional organizations such as: National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers; the Alabama Criminal Defense Lawyers Association; and the Greater Birmingham Criminal Defense Lawyers Association.  She is one of a handful of Alabama criminal defense attorneys who graduated from the National Criminal Defense College (NCDC).

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

About Belinda A. Weldon;    Belinda has been a criminal defense attorney since 1998. Belinda worked as a police officer for 15 years including twelve years in criminal investigations and forensics before becoming a criminal defense attorney.  As a former police investigator, she understands the criminal justice system; from both sides. Her experience and unique background enable her to work with clients through the toughest cases.    She knows the criminal justice system and gets excellent results for clients utilizing her experience both as a police investigator and forensic crime scene investigator which has made her an aggressive and successful criminal defense attorney.  Her ability to conduct criminal investigations for the defense as well as her unique understanding of forensic evidence is invaluable when defending her clients.    She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. She understands police procedure, prosecution tactics and the court process. She will fight for you every step of the way.   Belinda has successfully handled hundreds of criminal cases and jury trials from the most serious crimes such as capital murder to traffic violations like DUI.  She has experience in all aspects of criminal courts from bond hearings to jury trials where she has successfully won NOT GUILTY verdicts from capital murder cases to DUI cases.   She is a member of a number of professional organizations such as: National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers; the Alabama Criminal Defense Lawyers Association; and the Greater Birmingham Criminal Defense Lawyers Association.  She is one of a handful of Alabama criminal defense attorneys who graduated from the National Criminal Defense College (NCDC).

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. Belinda has successfully handled hundreds of criminal cases and jury trials from the most serious crimes such as capital murder to traffic violations like DUI.  She has experience in all aspects of criminal courts from bond hearings to jury trials where she has successfully won NOT GUILTY verdicts from capital murder cases to DUI cases.   She is a member of a number of professional organizations such as: National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers; the Alabama Criminal Defense Lawyers Association; and the Greater Birmingham Criminal Defense Lawyers Association. The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

About Belinda A. Weldon;    Belinda has been a criminal defense attorney since 1998.  She has devoted her career to aggressively defending people charged with crimes and protecting their constitutional rights. She has represented individuals in a broad variety of criminal matters, which has provided her with an in-depth understanding of Alabama criminal law and procedure.  Belinda worked as a police officer for 15 years including twelve years in criminal investigations and forensics before becoming a criminal defense attorney.  As a former police investigator, she understands the criminal justice system; from both sides. Her experience and unique background enable her to work with clients through the toughest cases.    She knows the criminal justice system and gets excellent results for clients utilizing her experience both as a police investigator and forensic crime scene investigator which has made her an aggressive and successful criminal defense attorney.  Her ability to conduct criminal investigations for the defense as well as her unique understanding of forensic evidence is invaluable when defending her clients.    She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. She understands police procedure, prosecution tactics and the court process. She will fight for you every step of the way.   Belinda has successfully handled hundreds of criminal cases and jury trials from the most serious crimes such as capital murder to traffic violations like DUI.  She has experience in all aspects of criminal courts from bond hearings to jury trials where she has successfully won NOT GUILTY verdicts from capital murder cases to DUI cases.   She is a member of a number of professional organizations such as: National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers; the Alabama Criminal Defense Lawyers Association; and the Greater Birmingham Criminal Defense Lawyers Association.  She is one of a handful of Alabama criminal defense attorneys who graduated from the National Criminal Defense College (NCDC).

Prior to founding Parkman White, LLP, Jim Parkman and William White-a former prosecutor- tried cases against one another. But in 2003 they joined forces, establishing a national firm that focuses on white collar crime criminal defense, bankruptcy, and divorce cases.

"Regardless of the case, we offer clients rigorous and sophisticated representation in a more cost-effective way than many of the larger firms." 
Attorneys at Parkman White, LLP have more than 100 years of combined experience in a wide range of practice areas, with a particular emphasis on courtroom litigation. Indeed, the firm is prepared to represent clients nationally or in any courtroom in Alabama. Parkman and White, meanwhile, have both been AV Preeminent rated by Martindale-Hubbell, a testament to the fact that their peers rank them at the highest level of professional experience. 
Parkman, who has handled hundreds of major felony cases during his 34-year career, attributes the firm’s success to its extensive courtroom expertise: "Ultimately, whether you win or lose the case is in the jury’s hands, so in order to be successful for your clients you have to know how to deal with a jury. The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

About Belinda A. Weldon;    Belinda has been a criminal defense attorney since 1998.  She has devoted her career to aggressively defending people charged with crimes and protecting their constitutional rights. Belinda worked as a police officer for 15 years including twelve years in criminal investigations and forensics before becoming a criminal defense attorney.  As a former police investigator, she understands the criminal justice system; from both sides. Her experience and unique background enable her to work with clients through the toughest cases.    She knows the criminal justice system and gets excellent results for clients utilizing her experience both as a police investigator and forensic crime scene investigator which has made her an aggressive and successful criminal defense attorney.  Her ability to conduct criminal investigations for the defense as well as her unique understanding of forensic evidence is invaluable when defending her clients.    She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. She understands police procedure, prosecution tactics and the court process. She will fight for you every step of the way.   Belinda has successfully handled hundreds of criminal cases and jury trials from the most serious crimes such as capital murder to traffic violations like DUI.  She has experience in all aspects of criminal courts from bond hearings to jury trials where she has successfully won NOT GUILTY verdicts from capital murder cases to DUI cases.   She is a member of a number of professional organizations such as: National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers; the Alabama Criminal Defense Lawyers Association; and the Greater Birmingham Criminal Defense Lawyers Association.  She is one of a handful of Alabama criminal defense attorneys who graduated from the National Criminal Defense College (NCDC).

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

About Belinda A. Weldon;    Belinda has been a criminal defense attorney since 1998.  She has devoted her career to aggressively defending people charged with crimes and protecting their constitutional rights. Belinda worked as a police officer for 15 years including twelve years in criminal investigations and forensics before becoming a criminal defense attorney.  As a former police investigator, she understands the criminal justice system; from both sides. Her experience and unique background enable her to work with clients through the toughest cases.    She knows the criminal justice system and gets excellent results for clients utilizing her experience both as a police investigator and forensic crime scene investigator which has made her an aggressive and successful criminal defense attorney.  Her ability to conduct criminal investigations for the defense as well as her unique understanding of forensic evidence is invaluable when defending her clients.    She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. She understands police procedure, prosecution tactics and the court process. She will fight for you every step of the way.   Belinda has successfully handled hundreds of criminal cases and jury trials from the most serious crimes such as capital murder to traffic violations like DUI.  She has experience in all aspects of criminal courts from bond hearings to jury trials where she has successfully won NOT GUILTY verdicts from capital murder cases to DUI cases.   She is a member of a number of professional organizations such as: National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers; the Alabama Criminal Defense Lawyers Association; and the Greater Birmingham Criminal Defense Lawyers Association.  She is one of a handful of Alabama criminal defense attorneys who graduated from the National Criminal Defense College (NCDC).

Prior to founding Parkman White, LLP, Jim Parkman and William White-a former prosecutor- tried cases against one another. But in 2003 they joined forces, establishing a national firm that focuses on white collar crime criminal defense, bankruptcy, and divorce cases. 
"We can handle the most complex, high-profile criminal cases anywhere in the country, as well as DUI, criminal, bankruptcy, civil litigation, probate and domestic cases throughout Alabama, from our offices in Birmingham and Dothan," White says. "Regardless of the case, we offer clients rigorous and sophisticated representation in a more cost-effective way than many of the larger firms." 
Attorneys at Parkman White, LLP have more than 100 years of combined experience in a wide range of practice areas, with a particular emphasis on courtroom litigation. Indeed, the firm is prepared to represent clients nationally or in any courtroom in Alabama. Parkman and White, meanwhile, have both been AV Preeminent rated by Martindale-Hubbell, a testament to the fact that their peers rank them at the highest level of professional experience. 
Parkman, who has handled hundreds of major felony cases during his 34-year career, attributes the firm’s success to its extensive courtroom expertise: "Ultimately, whether you win or lose the case is in the jury’s hands, so in order to be successful for your clients you have to know how to deal with a jury. And we’ve been involved in hundreds of jury trials over the years, spending thousands of hours in front of juries.

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

About Belinda A. Weldon;    Belinda has been a criminal defense attorney since 1998.  She has devoted her career to aggressively defending people charged with crimes and protecting their constitutional rights. She has represented individuals in a broad variety of criminal matters, which has provided her with an in-depth understanding of Alabama criminal law and procedure.  Belinda worked as a police officer for 15 years including twelve years in criminal investigations and forensics before becoming a criminal defense attorney.  As a former police investigator, she understands the criminal justice system; from both sides. Her experience and unique background enable her to work with clients through the toughest cases.    She knows the criminal justice system and gets excellent results for clients utilizing her experience both as a police investigator and forensic crime scene investigator which has made her an aggressive and successful criminal defense attorney.  Her ability to conduct criminal investigations for the defense as well as her unique understanding of forensic evidence is invaluable when defending her clients.    She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. She understands police procedure, prosecution tactics and the court process. She will fight for you every step of the way.   Belinda has successfully handled hundreds of criminal cases and jury trials from the most serious crimes such as capital murder to traffic violations like DUI.  She has experience in all aspects of criminal courts from bond hearings to jury trials where she has successfully won NOT GUILTY verdicts from capital murder cases to DUI cases.   She is a member of a number of professional organizations such as: National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers; the Alabama Criminal Defense Lawyers Association; and the Greater Birmingham Criminal Defense Lawyers Association.  She is one of a handful of Alabama criminal defense attorneys who graduated from the National Criminal Defense College (NCDC).

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

About Belinda A. Weldon;    Belinda has been a criminal defense attorney since 1998.  She has devoted her career to aggressively defending people charged with crimes and protecting their constitutional rights. Belinda worked as a police officer for 15 years including twelve years in criminal investigations and forensics before becoming a criminal defense attorney.  As a former police investigator, she understands the criminal justice system; from both sides. Her experience and unique background enable her to work with clients through the toughest cases.    She knows the criminal justice system and gets excellent results for clients utilizing her experience both as a police investigator and forensic crime scene investigator which has made her an aggressive and successful criminal defense attorney.  Her ability to conduct criminal investigations for the defense as well as her unique understanding of forensic evidence is invaluable when defending her clients.    She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. She understands police procedure, prosecution tactics and the court process. She will fight for you every step of the way.   Belinda has successfully handled hundreds of criminal cases and jury trials from the most serious crimes such as capital murder to traffic violations like DUI.  She has experience in all aspects of criminal courts from bond hearings to jury trials where she has successfully won NOT GUILTY verdicts from capital murder cases to DUI cases.   She is a member of a number of professional organizations such as: National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers; the Alabama Criminal Defense Lawyers Association; and the Greater Birmingham Criminal Defense Lawyers Association.  She is one of a handful of Alabama criminal defense attorneys who graduated from the National Criminal Defense College (NCDC).

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.

About Belinda A. Weldon;    Belinda has been a criminal defense attorney since 1998.  She has devoted her career to aggressively defending people charged with crimes and protecting their constitutional rights. She has represented individuals in a broad variety of criminal matters, which has provided her with an in-depth understanding of Alabama criminal law and procedure.  Belinda worked as a police officer for 15 years including twelve years in criminal investigations and forensics before becoming a criminal defense attorney.  As a former police investigator, she understands the criminal justice system; from both sides. Her experience and unique background enable her to work with clients through the toughest cases.    She knows the criminal justice system and gets excellent results for clients utilizing her experience both as a police investigator and forensic crime scene investigator which has made her an aggressive and successful criminal defense attorney.  Her ability to conduct criminal investigations for the defense as well as her unique understanding of forensic evidence is invaluable when defending her clients.    She can anticipate how your case may be handled and take steps to prevent complications. She knows the judges, prosecutors, police and the way the system works. She understands police procedure, prosecution tactics and the court process. She will fight for you every step of the way.   Belinda has successfully handled hundreds of criminal cases and jury trials from the most serious crimes such as capital murder to traffic violations like DUI.  She has experience in all aspects of criminal courts from bond hearings to jury trials where she has successfully won NOT GUILTY verdicts from capital murder cases to DUI cases.   She is a member of a number of professional organizations such as: National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers; the Alabama Criminal Defense Lawyers Association; and the Greater Birmingham Criminal Defense Lawyers Association.  She is one of a handful of Alabama criminal defense attorneys who graduated from the National Criminal Defense College (NCDC).

The law firm of Beddow, Erben & Bowen, PA has its origins in 1895, twenty five years after the founding of the City of Birmingham in 1871. Although the early focus of the practice was criminal defense, as the years, partners and associates have come and gone, our practice area has grown to incorporate business law, civil litigation, matrimonial and family law, and probate matters.  The firm's rich history includes members of the 1901 Alabama Constitutional Convention, the 10th Judicial Circuit Court, and the Alabama Supreme Court. Our members have been past presidents of the Alabama Bar Association, Committee members of the Legal Aid Board tasked with the establishment of Legal Aid Clinics, as well as the Grievance and Ethics Committee, and the Alabama State Bar Fee Arbitration Committee.  Our firm is well known for never shying away from representing unpopular clients. Periodically, such representation would result in the creation of important new law. For example, our involvement in the 1964 New York Times v. Sullivan case, resulted in a United States Supreme Court decision which established the actual malice standard in libel and defamation law and is a key decision supporting freedom of the press.  Beddow, Erben and Bowen, PA is the firm it is now because of Frederick A. Erben who has practiced here since he was admitted to the Bar in 1966. Through his leadership, our practice has and will continue to expand beyond its original focus. During his tenure, he was mentored by Roderick Beddow, Jr., and practiced with other lawyers who have since become Circuit Court and Alabama Supreme Court justices. Among other milestones during his practice, Mr. Erben and the firm participated in Civil Rights era cases, argued before the first Jefferson County Alabama jury to include women, and won sizeable monetary judgments against corporations, cities and insurance companies. Because of the influence of our talented past and present members, we are currently a firm uniquely prepared to handle almost any legal issue for any client.
